reg:regulation.reg:title: Single-Use and Plastic Waste Prevention Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: biodegradable plastic means any type of plastic that is, or is held out to be, biodegradable;
business operator means a person who, in the ordinary course of business, sells a commodity or product, whether by wholesale or retail;
compostable plastic means any type of plastic that is, or is held out to be, compostable;
customer includes a person to whom a commodity or product is distributed for free;
plastic includes any type of compostable plastic and any type of biodegradable plastic;
sell includes offer for sale;
single-use, when used in reference to an item, means the item is ordinarily disposed of after a single use or short-term use, whether or not it could be reused.
care facility means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an assisted living residence as defined in section 1 of the Community Care and Assisted Living Act;
a community care facility as defined in section 1 of the Community Care and Assisted Living Act;
a hospital as defined in section 1 of the Hospital Act;
a private hospital as defined in section 4.1 of the Hospital Act;
a Provincial mental health facility as defined in section 1 of the Mental Health Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: class A prohibited material means any of the following materials:
class B prohibited material means any of the following materials:

correctional facility means a lawful place of confinement, including, without limitation, a jail, prison, lockup, place of imprisonment, camp or correctional institution, and any land connected with it;
delivery order means an order for food or beverages, for delivery;
fish means fish as defined in section 1 of the Fish and Seafood Act;
food delivery platform operator means a person who provides ordering services to more than one food service provider through an online platform;
food service accessory means any of the following products:
food service provider means a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: who, in the ordinary course of business, prepares and serves food or beverages to individuals, or
in the case of a person who is not a business operator, whose activities ordinarily include preparing and serving food or beverages to individuals who are not members of the person's household;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: food service ware means any of the following types of container or packaging:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a box or carton, including an egg carton;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: ordering services means services provided to a food service provider in relation to a customer's delivery order that include facilitating the placement of the delivery order by the customer;
prepare, when used in relation to food or beverages, means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: cook, slice, chop, mix, brew, squeeze or otherwise make ready to eat or drink, or
remove from a container or packaging and place or repackage in a different container or different packaging;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: splash plug means any type of plug manufactured to prevent a beverage from spilling from the lid of its container;
utensil includes a spoon, fork, knife, chopstick, stir stick and splash plug.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The prohibitions in sections 12, 13 and 14 do not apply to food service accessories sold by a food service provider in quantities of 20 or more.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Restriction on single-use food service accessories

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A food service provider must not distribute or sell a single-use food service accessory.
The prohibition in subsection (1) does not apply in the following circumstances:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a customer requests, or accepts an offer of, the food service accessory, including by making a request or accepting an offer electronically;
the food service accessory is made available in a self-service manner;
the food service accessory is a beverage cup lid and is distributed with a beverage that is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: served through a window to a customer at a drive-through restaurant;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the food service accessory is distributed or sold at a care facility for use by a person admitted to or receiving assistance, care, supervision, treatment, maintenance or rehabilitation at the care facility;
the food service accessory is a utensil for use by a person confined in a correctional facility and at risk of self-harm or harming another person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A food service provider must not distribute or sell a single-use utensil that is wholly or partly composed of plastic.
The prohibition in subsection (1) does not apply if the utensil is for use by a person confined in a correctional facility and at risk of self-harm or harming another person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition on bundled single-use food service accessories

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A food service provider must not distribute or sell a single-use food service accessory that is bundled or pre-packaged together with one or more other single-use food service accessories.

The prohibition in subsection (1) does not apply if the food service accessory is distributed or sold at a care facility for use by an individual admitted to the care facility or receiving assistance, care, supervision, treatment, maintenance or rehabilitation at the care facility.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirement to keep records — single-use food service accessories

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A food delivery platform operator must keep, and make available for inspection under subsection (2), a record of the percentage of delivery orders received by the food delivery platform operator in each of the previous 2 calendar years in relation to which a food service accessory was requested or accepted.
An officer may inspect a record kept under subsection (1).
